titleStmt.title: Two speeches delivered by the Earl of Manchester, and Mr. Io: Pym, Esquire, in Guild-Hall, on Friday the 25. of Nov. 1642. Concerning a present supply of money for the army, and propositions for easing the city for the time to come: and laying the burthen on the neutrallists and malignants throughout the kingdom.
titleStmt.author: Manchester, Edward Montagu, Earl of, 1602-1671.
Pym, John, 1584-1643.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J. F. for Peter Cole, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Glove and Lyon, neer the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Pym and Manchester were "dispatched by Parliament to the city to announce the resolution" to levy a tax. cf. Gardiner, S. R. This history of the great Civil war. London, 1888-1901. v. 1, p. 74.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop at the sign of the Glove
